        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid word, else false.

        word - String that needs to be validated.
        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid word, else false.

      • isCustomLastWord

        public static boolean isCustomLastWord(java.lang.String word,
                                       java.lang.String delimeters)
        This function validates a string if it is a terminating word in a sentence. The terminating parameters are user defined.
        Parameters:
        word - String that needs to be validated.
        delimeters - The ending parameters for the word to validate word termination. The parameters should be placed in sequence without any gaps. For backslash, you need to put '\\\\' because the string parser will remove two of them when "de-escaping" it for the string, and then the regex needs two for an escaped regex backslash. 
        For example : isCustomLastWord(yourString,"/}\\\\") will check for /, }, \ as word termination parameters.
        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid word, else false.

      • isSentence

        public static boolean isSentence(java.lang.String sentence)
        This function validates if a string is valid a sentence.
        Parameters:
        sentence - String that needs to be validated.
        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid word, else false.

      • isPhoneno

        public static boolean isPhoneno(java.lang.String phoneno,
                                java.lang.String format)
                         throws InvalidFormatException
        This function validates if a string is valid a phone number for an user defined format.
        Parameters:
        phoneno - String that needs to be validated.
        format - The custom format of the phone number. 
         For example XXX-XXX where X has to be in uppercase and X represents a possible digit.
        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid word, else false.
        Throws:
        InvalidFormatException - Throws exception on format mismatch.

      • isName

        public static boolean isName(java.lang.String name,
                             boolean checkHonorific,
                             boolean isAllUpperCase)
        This function validates if a string is valid a valid name. The honorific is allowed if user defined.
        Parameters:
        name - String that needs to be validated.
        checkHonorific - True if name includes a honorific else false.
        isAllUpperCase - True is all the letters are in uppercase, else false. Then it checks if the first letter of every starting word is in uppercase.
        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid word, else false.

      • isDefaultPassword

        public static boolean isDefaultPassword(java.lang.String password,
                                        int defaultSettings)
         This function checks if a String satisfies predetermined password parameters. The defaultSettings here are predetermined. 
 defaultSettings values are : 
 1 if check for any 8 characters including alphabets, digits and symbols.
 2 if check for minimum 8 characters including minimum one uppercase and one digit.
 3 if check for minimum 8 characters including minimum one uppercase, digit, symbol and 8 characters.
        Parameters:
        password - String that needs to be validated.
        defaultSettings - Can be 1, 2 or 3. Each are entitled to different parameters. 
         1 if check for any 8 characters including alphabets, digits and symbols.
 2 if check for minimum 8 characters including minimum one uppercase and one digit.
 3 if check for minimum 8 characters including minimum one uppercase, digit, symbol and 8 characters.
        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid word, else false.

      • isCustomPasswordParametric

        public static boolean[] isCustomPasswordParametric(java.lang.String password,
                                                   CustomPasswordFilter customPasswordFilter)
        This function checks for individual parameter validations, i.e it individually checks for alphabets, digits and symbols. 
         Returns a boolean array of length 5. Each index has it's own significance. Default value is false.
 Index 0 - Alphabet validation along with minimum alphabet length check.
 Index 1 - Digit validation along with minimum digit length check.
 Index 2 - Symbol validation along with minimum symbol length check.
 Index 3 - Total minimum length check.
 Index 4 - Total maximum length check.
 Under any circumstances if pattern has characters that are not in the argument string, then index 0, 1, 2 will return false.
 For example, if alphabets are "ABCdef", digits are "012" and symbol set is "$%" with minimum characters 2,1,1 respectively.
 Then for pattern "ABC",
 index 0 : true, index 1 : false, index 2: false.
 for pattern "AB0"
 index 0 : true, index 1 : true, index 2: false.
 but for pattern "AB04", even if alphabet satisfies, but pattern as a whole is invalid hence output will be 
 index 0 : false, index 1 : false, index 2: false.
        Parameters:
        password - String that needs to be validated.
        customPasswordFilter - instance of CustomPasswordFilter.
        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid word, else false.

      • isCustomPassword

        public static boolean isCustomPassword(java.lang.String password,
                                       CustomPasswordFilter customPasswordFilter)
        This function allows you to design custom password parameters.
        Parameters:
        password - String that needs to be validated.
        customPasswordFilter - instance of CustomPasswordFilter.
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • isAlphanumeric

        public static boolean isAlphanumeric(java.lang.String alphanumeric)
        This function checks if an input string has alphanumeric bits, i.e if they are made of 0-9 and A-Z.
 Alphabets have to be in Uppercase.
        Parameters:
        alphanumeric - String that needs to be validated.
        Returns:
        True if the String is a valid alphanumeric input, else false.
